t3.desc: Details about changes from release to release

t16.title: The DITA For Publishers Open Toolkit Plugins

t17.title: Installing the Toolkit Plugins
t17.desc: How to install the DITA for Publishers Toolkit plugins to the Open Toolkit.

t18.title: Generating EPUBs and Kindle Books from DITA Content
t18.desc: The D4P EPUB and Kindle book generation Open Toolkit plugins enable generation of delivery-ready EPUBs and Kindle books from any conforming DITA content.

t19.title: Generating EPUBs From OxygenXML
t19.desc: You can configure a DITA transformation scenario in OxygenXML to generate EPUBs.

t20.title: Generating Kindle Books From OxygenXML
t20.desc: You can configure a DITA transformation scenario in OxygenXML to generate Kindle books.

t21.title: Using Custom CSS Style Sheets
t21.desc: You can include custom CSS styles sheets in your EPUB just as you can for HTML output generally.
t21.keywords: args.copycss args.css args.csspath args.css.output.dir args.css args.cssroot args.css args.cssroot args.css args.cssroot args.css css.output.dir

t22.title: Creating Cover Graphics and Covers
t22.desc: Some readers and book libraries, such as iBooks, have special conventions for cover graphics.
t22.keywords: topicmeta data epub-cover-graphic covers epub-cover-graphic meta map

t23.title: Creating Arbitrary EPUB OPF Metadata
t23.keywords: data data name name meta @value data content meta args.xsl

t24.title: Implementing Overrides for Common Processing
t24.desc: You can use the same args.xsl parameter as for the XHTML transform to specify a custom top-level transform that includes overrides to the base processing.

t25.title: EPUB and Kindle Transformation Parameters
t25.desc: EPUB-specific parameters for the EPUB transformation type

t26.title: args.css.output.dir Ant parameter
t26.desc:
Specifies the directory to put CSS files into for EPUB and Kindle
    transforms.

t27.title: cover.graphic.file Ant parameter
t27.desc: Specifies the absolute or relative path of the graphic to use as the cover graphic for the EPUB.

t28.title: d4p.max.nav.depth Ant parameter
t28.desc:
Specifies the maximum depth of the navigation table of
    contents.

t29.title: d4p.max.toc.depth Ant parameter
t29.desc:
Specifies the maximum depth of the generated HTML table of
    contents.

t30.title: epub.exclude.auto.rellinks Ant parameter
t30.desc: Turns on exclusion of auto-generated related links (as for normal HTML output)

t31.title: epub.pubid.uri.stub Ant parameter
t31.desc: Specifies the URI prefix stub to use in constructing the full EPUB ID value in the EPUB metadata.

t32.title: epub.temp.dir Ant parameter
t32.desc: Specifies the directory to use for EPUB-specific processing separate from the main Toolkit's temp directory.

t33.title: images.output.dir Ant parameter
t33.desc: Specifies the name of the directory within the EPUB to hold all images.

t34.title: kindlegen.executable Ant parameter
t34.desc: Specifies the name, and if necessary, full path of the kindlegen command-line executable

t35.title: title.only.topic.class.spec Ant parameter
t35.desc: Specifies the @class attribute value to use for title-only topics generated from topicheads.

t36.title: title.only.topic.title.class.spec Ant parameter
t36.desc: Specifies the @class attribute value to use for titles for title-only topics generated from topicheads.

t37.title: topics.output.dir Ant parameter
t37.desc: Specifies the name of the directory within the EPUB to hold all the topics.

t38.title: Map-Driven Processing
t38.desc:
Using and extending the DITA for Publishers map-driven processing
    framework

t39.title: Numbering Things: Collected Data and Enumeration
t39.desc:
How to use the collected enumeration data to number things in
    output.
t39.keywords: bodydiv sectiondiv div enum:enumerables class df:generate-dita-id() enumeration xsl:number

t40.title: Index Generation
t40.desc:
Overview of using the grouped and sorted index entries in the
    collected data to do index generation.
t40.keywords: index-terms:ungrouped index-terms:grouped-and-sorted index-terms:index-term indexterm group-and-sort-index gather-index-terms local:construct-index-group-key() local:construct-index-term-grouping-key()

t41.title: Graphic Map Generation
t41.desc:
The map-driven processing generates an Ant script that copies
    graphics from their source locations to the output location.

t43.title: Understanding the HTML2 Transformations
t43.desc: Guidance on how the HTML2 XSLT transformations are organized and how the processing works.

t44.title: Overall HTML Generation Process Flow
t44.desc: Describes the overall processing flow for the HTML2 transformation

t45.title: Extending and Customizing Enumeration Processing (Numbering)
t45.desc: How to customize and extend the default enumeration processing for topic titles and other numbered things.

t46.title: HTML2 Transformation Parameters
t46.desc: Unique parameters for the HTML2 transformation type

t47.title: html2.file.organization.strategy Ant parameter
t47.desc: Names the output file organization strategy to use for generated files.

t48.title: html2.generate.dynamic.toc Ant parameter
t48.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate a dynamic TOC in the output.

t49.title: html2.generate.frameset Ant parameter
t49.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate an HTML frameset file for the map.

t50.title: html2.generate.static.toc Ant parameter
t50.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate a static TOC in the output.

t51.title: HTML5 Plugin
t51.desc:
The HTML5 transformation type produces HTML5-based output that integrates newer web
    technologies, such as HTML5, CSS3, responsive layouts.

t52.title: Getting Started With the HTML5 Transformation

t54.title: Downloading HTML5 plugin
t54.desc: The html5 plugin is part of the DITA for Publishers set of plugins.

t55.title: Specific installation notes for developpers
t55.desc:
If you want to do development with HTML5 plugin, you will need to
        install the YUI compressor tool.

t56.title: Running the HTML5 Plugin
t56.desc: The HTML5 plugin can run as a regular DITA-OT plugin.

t57.title: Changed Behaviours
t57.desc:
This plugin does not always behaves the same way than others DITA OT
  plugins.

t58.title: License
t58.desc: The DITA for Publishers project is released under the Apache License V2.0

t60.title: Replacing the index.html file
t60.desc:
The HTML5 transformation type does not produce an index.html file by
  default.

t61.title: Multiple columns layout
t61.desc:
The html5plugin can allows you to use the latest CSS multi-columns layout for the browsers that support
        it.

t62.title: CSS grid
t62.desc:
The html5 plugin use the 960 Grid System, which allows technical writters to use the
  attribute outputclass to positions their elements on the grid.

t63.title: Image support
t63.desc: The plugin offers the different options for images.

t64.title: Notes
t64.desc: Notes are output with the aside element except when @importance is set to low or obsolete, which will output a details elements. Details elements should be collapsed by default on new browsers.

t65.title: UI
t65.desc: The plugin allows to interact with jQuery UI to output UI on the content.

t66.title: Accordion
t66.desc: Accordion are alternate navigation used to browse the content more quickly.

t67.title: Cycle
t67.desc: This UI allows to present your image in a slideshow.

t68.title: Developpers
t68.desc: General information to customize the plugin and create a new Theme

t69.title: Creating a customization plugin
t69.desc:
The steps required to create a customization plugin does not differ from others
  DITA-OT plugin.

t70.title: Theme Development
t70.desc:
The theme mechanism is a preprocessing and packaging mechanism which works on CSS and
  javascripts.

t71.title: The Theme cache process
t71.desc: The image belows presents the theme cache process

t72.title: Theme configuration file: principle
t72.desc:
The theme configuration file allows to specify which files you want to concatenate and
  compress into a single file. It also provide the information to the html5 xsl code to generate the
  right link and scripts elements.

t73.title: Let's explore the configuration file
t73.desc: The Theme configuration file is pretty simple to create

t74.title: How to add Internet Explorer conditional css

t75.title: Adding Google analytics tracking code
t75.desc: To add google analytics to your theme, you need add this code to the theme.xml

t77.title: Directory structure
t77.desc: The following describes the structure of the plugin directory.

t78.title: Availaible ant properties
t78.desc: This properties allows to customize the output.
